intro: Asperula aspera, commonly known as the rough woodruff, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a rough, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Asperula aspera is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soil.
